sentences.english: Conclusion The gingival recession and the wedge shaped defect are common dental diseases in the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 结论牙龈退缩与楔状缺损是中老年人常见的牙病。

sentences.english: Therefore, the female should choose this time treat odontopathy to well.
sentences.chinese: 因此，女性应选择此时治疗牙病为最好。

sentences.english: There was also evidence gum disease in men impaired their sperm quality.
sentences.chinese: 同时，证据也表明牙病还会削弱男性的精子质量。

sentences.english: Therefore, the female should better avoid the monthly period to treat odontopathy again.
sentences.chinese: 故此，女性最好避开月经期再治疗牙病。

sentences.english: Gum disease could significantly delay the chances of conceiving, fertility specialists have found.
sentences.chinese: 生殖专家发现，牙病会明显推迟怀孕的时间。

sentences.english: The odontopathy is one of the main diseases which are accepted as influence people's health.
sentences.chinese: 牙病已经是一种公认影响人们健康的主要疾病之一了。

sentences.english: Daily Rixi buckle teeth 60 times each, can prevent dental teeth and tooth loss.
sentences.chinese: 每日日夕扣齿各60次，可健齿防牙病和牙齿零落等。

sentences.english: Lily: The odontopathy is one of the main diseases which are accepted as influence people's health.
sentences.chinese: 牙病已经是一种公认影响人们健康的主要疾病之一了。

sentences.english: It is easily treated, usually involving no more than four dental visits.
sentences.chinese: 牙病很容易医治，就诊一般不会超过四次。

definition: caries/rotten tooth (colloquial)/see also 齲齒|龋齿[qu3 chi3]
to fill a tooth (cavity)/to have a tooth filled/a dental filling
stomatitis/ulceration of oral cavity/inflammation of the mucous lining of the mouth
